values.value:
Consequences of Rule Violation


(a) Greenheart Exchange may terminate my program sponsorship for any of the following reasons.

  • I fail to notify Greenheart Exchange that I will arrive in the United States after my program start date.
  • I fail to validate my program within seven days after my arrival to the United States.
  • I fail to maintain contact with Greenheart, whether in my 30 days check-ins or when I am on additional monitoring.
  • I fail to submit the Department of State required Cross-Cultural Activity (CCA) reports (two per academic year).
  • I leave my teaching position without prior consent from Greenheart Exchange in writing.
  • I start to work at a second job.
  • I fail to report a change in my housing address or telephone number.
  • I am found guilty of or plead guilty to violating any local, state, or federal law.
  • I engage in behavior that may bring disrepute to the J-1 Teacher program.
  • I violate any Greenheart Exchange program rule.
  • I misrepresent my personal or medical information to Greenheart Exchange.

(b) If Greenheart Exchange terminates my program sponsorship, I must return to my home country at my own expense immediately. If my program is terminated because I violated U.S. law, I will be subject to repatriation as soon as I fulfill any legal obligations in the U.S.

(c) If Greenheart Exchange terminates my program sponsorship, I will not receive a refund for my program.

(d) If my program sponsorship is terminated, it will negatively affect my chances and the chances of my family members to receive a visa to the U.S. in the future.

(e) Greenheart Exchange is required to report to the U.S. Department of State and/or U.S. Homeland Security any activity that is interpreted as being in defiance of visa or program regulations.
